fileManager

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileManager.FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods that operate on Files, with read and write operations.
    Author:
    Filipe, Rita G, Rita A, Hussein

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static FileManager getInstance()

      • readRules

        public java.lang.Object[][] readRules()
                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads the rules from the rules file
        Returns:
        Object[][] A matrix of rules (String) and the correspondent weight (Integer).
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the given path doesn't correspond to a file

      • evaluate

        public int[] evaluate(java.lang.Object[][] data)
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Evaluates the given configuration to determine the false positives and false negatives
        Parameters:
        data - The configuration to be evaluated
        Returns:
        The result of the given configuration; the false positives and false negatives
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if source is not found

      • saveConfig

        public void saveConfig(java.lang.Object[][] data,
                       java.lang.String path)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                       java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Saves the current configuration of weights in the file specified by the path
        Parameters:
        data - The content to be saved. This includes the rules and the correspondent weights
        path - The path to the file where the configuration will be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the given string does not denote an existing, writable regular file and a new regular file of that name cannot be created, or if some other error occurs while opening or creating the file
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - If the named charset is not supported

      • addPaths

        public void addPaths(java.lang.String[] paths)
        Uses the paths to create the File instances of rules ham spam
        Parameters:
        paths - the paths that will be added to the File Manager

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        Checks if the given paths correspond to files
        Returns:
        true if the paths correspond to files; false otherwise

      • readResults

        public double[] readResults(java.lang.String path)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads the preferred result from the file created by the JMetal algorithm "AntiSpamFilterProblem.rf". The preferred result is the one with the fewer false negatives.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file with the results
        Returns:
        The result with the fewer false negatives, created by the JMetal algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if source is not found

      • readWeights

        public double[] readWeights(java.lang.String path)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads the preferred weights from the file created by the JMetal algorithm "AntiSpamFilterProblem.rs"
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file with the weights
        Returns:
        The weights that the JMetal algorithm considered optimal
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if source is not found
